title: Confusing communication and inconsequent, and undesired behavior of `install`

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
````
$ datalad install -d . --reckless -s ../aligned src/aligned
Total: 100%|███████████████████████████████████████████████████████▉| 36.0M/36.0M [00:00<00:00, 62.9MB/s]
[INFO   ] Installing subdataset from '../aligned' at: ../aligned 

[INFO   ] Saving possible changes to <Dataset path=/home/kbenz/taste2_data/collection/testballoon> - installed subdatasets: src/aligned 
1 installed item is available at
<Dataset path=/home/kbenz/taste2_data/collection/testballoon/src/aligned>
````

The first info line is wrong (seems to state the source twice), and scared the shit out of my -- this was on real data ....

After the command (which basically did everything right) I am left with this:

````
$ git diff HEAD..HEAD~1
diff --git a/src/aligned b/src/aligned
deleted file mode 160000
index 9bde30d..0000000
--- a/src/aligned
+++ /dev/null
@@ -1 +0,0 @@
-Subproject commit 9bde30de94b4d787f44ed8be6708320709a0032d
$ git status
On branch master
Changes to be committed:
  (use "git reset HEAD <file>..." to unstage)

	modified:   .gitmodules
````

So the subdataset is commited, the module config is not.

Moreover:

````
$ git diff HEAD
diff --git a/.gitmodules b/.gitmodules
index 982a8ad..7069686 100644
--- a/.gitmodules
+++ b/.gitmodules
@@ -9,4 +9,4 @@
        url = ./src/aligned
 [submodule "src/aligned"]
        path = src/aligned
-       url = ./src/aligned
+       url = /some/abs/path/collection/aligned
````

There are two things to this:

1. I gave a relative path to install from, but an absolute path was recorded. I don't think that is a good idea.
2. you can see that a submodule was registered at that location before -- which I had accidentally `rm`'ed before running this command.

Auto-saving had commit that change before installation, but only like so:

````
$ git diff HEAD~2..HEAD~1 -- src/
diff --git a/src/aligned b/src/aligned
deleted file mode 120000
index c800611..0000000
--- a/src/aligned
+++ /dev/null
@@ -1 +0,0 @@
-../../aligned/
\ No newline at end of file
````

I am not sure what should actually happen in this. It seems somewhat correct behavior, as in I could simply reobtain the deleted subdataset, but I wanted to bring it up nevertheless,
